title.rendered: Vaughan Home Repairs: DIY Electrical Projects To Avoid

content.rendered:
There are some home repairs or improvement projects that are simple enough that you may be able to handle them on your own, even without any education or training. However, if the problem involves your home electrical system, even if it seems relatively minor, you are better off calling an electrician in Vaughan rather than trying to tackle it yourself.

If you don’t know what you are doing, you could make a mistake that compromises the entire electrical system. Repairing the damage may be beyond your capabilities, and you might have no choice but to call in a professional to correct it. This could cost a lot more than you would have spent to have the job performed professionally in the first place. Furthermore, improper wiring could put you at risk of a house fire.

While there are very few electrical projects that you can do by yourself, here are three that you should absolutely avoid.

1. Circuit Installation

The circuit refers to a particular electrical outlet and the wiring that connects it to the main panel. You may have to install a new circuit if there are not enough electrical outlets in a given room to accommodate all the appliances that you want to plug in. You may also have to either install new circuits or update existing ones if your circuit breaker keeps tripping all the time. No matter why you want to install new circuits, you should call an electrician in Vaughan to handle the job. It is too complicated and dangerous to handle on your own, especially if you do not have any electrical knowledge.

2. Wiring Upgrades

In the early days of electricity, the demands placed on household wiring were much less than they are today. If your home is older and has the original wiring, it may not be adequate for powering today’s appliances. Even if the wiring is only several decades old, it might not quite be up to the task.

Wiring is complicated and should only be trusted to electrical repair services. Not only is there a chance of a house fire if you do it incorrectly, but your amateur attempts may not be up to code. If this is the case, you may fail a safety inspection if you ever attempt to sell your home. This complicates the selling process and requires you to spend more money to make repairs so that the wiring is back in compliance.

3. Fan Installation

It doesn’t matter whether you wish to install an exhaust fan or a ceiling fan. Each is a complicated job that could have unforeseen consequences if you attempt it yourself. For example, an exhaust fan could promote mould growth or release fumes back into your home if you do not seal it correctly. A gap between a fan and the ceiling could cause it to make a constant vibration noise, which is annoying even if it isn’t dangerous. Additionally, as with any electrical repair or installation, improper wiring could cause problems that may not be evident immediately but could be dangerous in the long run. If you do not have the knowledge and ability to perform the meticulous work involved in installing any type of fan, it is best to call someone who does to perform the job.

4. Electrical Panel Work

As new technology continues to make increasing demands on your electrical system, it may be necessary to install a whole new panel. You may not have the ability to determine whether a repair or a replacement is needed, let alone the capability to perform the necessary work correctly. The job of the panel is to prevent dangerous electrical overloads, and if you perform the job yourself, you may not be able to verify that it will function correctly.

Find an Electrician in Vaughan at Handyman Connection

The stakes are too high to leave electrical repair services to chance. Call Handyman Connection to hire a qualified technician.

*All electrical work is subcontracted to ECRA/ESA Licensed Electrical Contractors
